items.title: What is a government shutdown? Here's what happens when funding runs out
items.standfirst: Much of the federal government is on the verge of shutting down​ if Congress does not reach a deal to approve new funding by Oct. 1. Here's what that means.
items.content: Much of the federal government is on the verge of shutting down​ if Congress does not reach a deal to approve new funding by Oct. 1. Here's what that means.

items.title: Israel accepts Trump’s Gaza peace proposal but no word from Hamas
items.standfirst: President Trump revealed his new ceasefire proposal for Gaza after a meeting with Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at the White House. Netanyahu agreed to the plan, but Hamas has not responded. Trump said Israel’s war against Hamas should continue if Hamas rejects his proposal. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez reports.
items.content: President Trump revealed his new ceasefire proposal for Gaza after a meeting with Israel’s Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at the White House. Netanyahu agreed to the plan, but Hamas has not responded. Trump said Israel’s war against Hamas should continue if Hamas rejects his proposal. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez reports.

items.title: Vance says government appears headed toward shutdown
items.standfirst: Vice President JD Vance said Monday he thinks there will be a government shutdown as Republicans and Democrats continue negotiations ahead of Tuesday's funding deadline. CBS News congressional reporter Taurean Small has more.
items.content: Vice President JD Vance said Monday he thinks there will be a government shutdown as Republicans and Democrats continue negotiations ahead of Tuesday's funding deadline. CBS News congressional reporter Taurean Small has more.

items.title: Hamas yet to respond to Trump's new Gaza peace proposal
items.standfirst: President Trump announced a comprehensive plan Monday that he hopes will end the war in Gaza. Hamas hasn't responded to the plan yet. CBS News senior White House correspondent Ed O'Keefe reports.
items.content: President Trump announced a comprehensive plan Monday that he hopes will end the war in Gaza. Hamas hasn't responded to the plan yet. CBS News senior White House correspondent Ed O'Keefe reports.

items.title: Trump talks with Democrats fail to yield breakthrough as US shutdown nears
items.standfirst: Democrats strike optimistic tone after high-stakes meeting but Republicans accuse rivals of ‘hostage-taking’US politics – latest updatesA high-stakes meeting between Donald Trump and top congressional Democrats on Monday resulted in no apparent breakthrough in negotiations to keep the government open, with JD Vance declaring afterwards: “I think we are headed into a shutdown.”Democrats, who are refusing to support the GOP’s legislation to continue funding beyond Tuesday unless it includes several healthcare provisions, struck a more optimistic tone following the Oval Office encounter, which also included the Republican leaders of the Senate and House of Representatives. Continue reading...
items.content: Democrats strike optimistic tone after high-stakes meeting but Republicans accuse rivals of ‘hostage-taking’US politics – latest updatesA high-stakes meeting between Donald Trump and top congressional Democrats on Monday resulted in no apparent breakthrough in negotiations to keep the government open, with JD Vance declaring afterwards: “I think we are headed into a shutdown.”Democrats, who are refusing to support the GOP’s legislation to continue funding beyond Tuesday unless it includes several healthcare provisions, struck a more optimistic tone following the Oval Office encounter, which also included the Republican leaders of the Senate and House of Representatives. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Vice President JD Vance announced on Monday that the US government was "headed to a shutdown", unless an agreement is reached between Republicans and Democrats in Congress. Trump and Democrats remain in a budget stand-off, with health care tax breaks at the centre of the dispute.

items.title: What’s in Trump’s 20-point peace plan for Gaza?
items.standfirst: Plan calls for immediate end to war between Israel and Hamas but lacks detail on how key points will be executedThe White House peace plan for Gaza proposes an immediate end to the devastating war between Israel and Hamas that has raged in the coastal territory for nearly two years, while pointedly excluding the Palestinian militant group from any future governing role.Assuming both sides agree to a detailed list of conditions, the end of fighting will be accompanied by the release of all Israeli hostages, both dead and alive, “within 72 hours” of Israel publicly accepting the deal. Continue reading...
items.content: Plan calls for immediate end to war between Israel and Hamas but lacks detail on how key points will be executedThe White House peace plan for Gaza proposes an immediate end to the devastating war between Israel and Hamas that has raged in the coastal territory for nearly two years, while pointedly excluding the Palestinian militant group from any future governing role.Assuming both sides agree to a detailed list of conditions, the end of fighting will be accompanied by the release of all Israeli hostages, both dead and alive, “within 72 hours” of Israel publicly accepting the deal. Continue reading...

items.title: The key points: What's in Trump's plan to end Gaza war?
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump's 20-point plan to end the war in Gaza calls for an immediate ceasefire in the ravaged Palestinian territory, the release of hostages within 72 hours, the disarmament of Hamas, and a gradual Israeli withdrawal. Other key points include the deployment of a "temporary international stabilisation force" – and the creation of a transitional authority headed by Trump himself
items.content: US President Donald Trump's 20-point plan to end the war in Gaza calls for an immediate ceasefire in the ravaged Palestinian territory, the release of hostages within 72 hours, the disarmament of Hamas, and a gradual Israeli withdrawal. Other key points include the deployment of a "temporary international stabilisation force" – and the creation of a transitional authority headed by Trump himself

items.standfirst: Pair say proposal represents new chapter but Israeli PM threatens to ‘finish the job’ if Hamas officials fail to agreeDonald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister, have delivered an ultimatum to Hamas, warning the militant group to accept their 20-point peace plan for Gaza or face the consequences.The two leaders met at the White House in Washington on Monday then held a joint press briefing in which they hailed their proposal as a historic breakthrough and new chapter for the Middle East. items.content: Ahead of the leaders' meeting on Monday, the White House released its peace plan to immediately end Israel's war in the territory, boost aid to Gaza and require Hamas to release Israeli hostages.(Image credit: Jim Lo Scalzo)

items.title: Live: Netanyahu, Palestinian Authority, and Middle Eastern leaders back Trump's Gaza plan
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said Monday that Washington was "beyond very close" to securing peace in the Gaza war, after meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and releasing a 20-point peace plan. Backing the proposal, Netanyahu said Israel would "retain security responsibility" in Gaza after the war – and would "finish the job" against Hamas should it reject Trump's plan. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said Monday that Washington was "beyond very close" to securing peace in the Gaza war, after meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and releasing a 20-point peace plan. Backing the proposal, Netanyahu said Israel would "retain security responsibility" in Gaza after the war – and would "finish the job" against Hamas should it reject Trump's plan. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

items.title: Verizon Is in Talks to Purchase EchoStar Wireless Spectrum
Verizon Is in Talks to Purchase EchoStar Wireless Spectrum
items.standfirst: Verizon Communications Inc. is in discussions with EchoStar Corp. about purchasing some of its wireless spectrum, according to people familiar with the matter.
items.content: Verizon Communications Inc. is in discussions with EchoStar Corp. about purchasing some of its wireless spectrum, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: S&P Says It Expects To Cut Electronic Arts to Junk Status
S&P Says It Expects To Cut Electronic Arts to Junk Status
items.standfirst: S&P Global Ratings said it expects to cut Electronic Arts Inc.’s credit grades to junk status after the video-game maker’s buyout deal is closed, citing the expected addition of about $20 billion of debt from the transaction.
items.content: S&P Global Ratings said it expects to cut Electronic Arts Inc.’s credit grades to junk status after the video-game maker’s buyout deal is closed, citing the expected addition of about $20 billion of debt from the transaction.

items.title: Gaming giant EA to be taken private in a $55bn deal
items.standfirst: Electronic Arts, the company behind blockbuster video games such as the Sims and Madden NFL, has agreed to transfer ownership to a consortium led by Saudi Arabia's public investment fund PIF, US private equity firm Silver Lake and Jared Kushner's Affinity Partners. The $55 bn deal marks the largest leveraged buyout in history. Meanwhile, China is launching a new visa programme to attract young foreign talent, after Washington shocked the tech world with a new $100,000 fee for its H1-B visa.
items.content: Electronic Arts, the company behind blockbuster video games such as the Sims and Madden NFL, has agreed to transfer ownership to a consortium led by Saudi Arabia's public investment fund PIF, US private equity firm Silver Lake and Jared Kushner's Affinity Partners. The $55 bn deal marks the largest leveraged buyout in history. Meanwhile, China is launching a new visa programme to attract young foreign talent, after Washington shocked the tech world with a new $100,000 fee for its H1-B visa.

items.title: Black Forest Labs, AI Image Partner for Meta, in Talks for Funding at $4 Billion Valuation

items.content: German artificial intelligence startup Black Forest Labs is in discussions to raise funding that could boost its valuation to around $4 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: Video game maker Electronic Arts to be taken private in record $55bn mega-deal
items.standfirst: Deal with The Sims and Madden NFL maker is biggest leveraged buyout attempt, another key move for Silver LakeElectronic Arts, maker of video games such as Madden NFL, Battlefield, and The Sims, is being acquired for $55bn, the biggest leveraged buyout attempt in history.Under the terms of the deal announced on Monday, the private equity firm Silver Lake Partners, Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund PIF and Affinity Partners will pay EA’s stockholders $210 per share. Affinity Partners is a private equity firm run by Donald Trump’s son-in-law, Jared Kushner. Continue reading...
items.content: Deal with The Sims and Madden NFL maker is biggest leveraged buyout attempt, another key move for Silver LakeElectronic Arts, maker of video games such as Madden NFL, Battlefield, and The Sims, is being acquired for $55bn, the biggest leveraged buyout attempt in history.Under the terms of the deal announced on Monday, the private equity firm Silver Lake Partners, Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund PIF and Affinity Partners will pay EA’s stockholders $210 per share. Affinity Partners is a private equity firm run by Donald Trump’s son-in-law, Jared Kushner. Continue reading...

items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu met with US tech executives and investors in New York on Sunday to discuss the prospects for using artificial intelligence to boost his country’s economy and military capabilities, according to people familiar with the matter.

items.title: Google to Pay $24.5 Million to End Trump Jan. 6 Ban Lawsuit
items.standfirst: Alphabet Inc.’s Google agreed to pay $24.5 million to resolve Donald Trump’s claims that being banished from his YouTube channel after the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the US Capitol was illegal censorship, according to a court filing.
items.content: Alphabet Inc.’s Google agreed to pay $24.5 million to resolve Donald Trump’s claims that being banished from his YouTube channel after the Jan. 6, 2021, riot at the US Capitol was illegal censorship, according to a court filing.

ai_summary: YouTube will pay $24.5 million to settle Trump's lawsuit.
The lawsuit was filed over account suspension after January 6.
Trump filed similar suits against X and Meta.
The settlement is the last of Trump's Big Tech lawsuits.
Part of the settlement money will support a White House ballroom.

clusters.title: Madagascar president dissolves government after youth-led deadly protests
clusters.neutral_headline: Madagascar government dissolved amid protests

items.title: Madagascar president dissolves government after youth-led deadly protests
items.standfirst: The demonstrations, which started over deteriorating living conditions, have left 22 people dead, according to the UN.
items.content: The demonstrations, which started over deteriorating living conditions, have left 22 people dead, according to the UN.

items.title: Madagascar President dissolves government amid youth protests over water, power cuts
items.standfirst: There were more protests in Madagascar on Monday, even as President Andry Rajoelina tried to quell popular outrage by firing the government. There have been days of unrest across the country over its crumbling infrastructure. On Monday, the UN estimated that at least 22 people had died in crackdowns on youth-led marches that first erupted last Thursday. The UN's human rights chief said he was shocked by the extent to which security officers responded with force. However, some of the deaths have been attributed to looting and violence by gangs taking advantage of the unrest.
items.content: There were more protests in Madagascar on Monday, even as President Andry Rajoelina tried to quell popular outrage by firing the government. There have been days of unrest across the country over its crumbling infrastructure. On Monday, the UN estimated that at least 22 people had died in crackdowns on youth-led marches that first erupted last Thursday. The UN's human rights chief said he was shocked by the extent to which security officers responded with force. However, some of the deaths have been attributed to looting and violence by gangs taking advantage of the unrest.

items.title: Madagascar's president dissolves government after 'Gen Z' protests
items.standfirst: The UN says 22 people have been killed and more than 100 others injured since protests broke out on Thursday.
items.content: The UN says 22 people have been killed and more than 100 others injured since protests broke out on Thursday.

items.title: Madagascar’s president dissolves government amid youth-led protests
items.standfirst: Demonstrations over water and power cuts inspired by ‘gen-Z’ protests elsewhere have left at least 22 dead, says UNMadagascar’s president, Andry Rajoelina, has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts in which the UN says at least 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured.Inspired by the “gen Z” protests in Kenya and Nepal, the three days of demonstrations are the largest the Indian Ocean island has seen in years, and the most serious challenge Rajoelina has faced since his re-election in 2023. Continue reading...
items.content: Demonstrations over water and power cuts inspired by ‘gen-Z’ protests elsewhere have left at least 22 dead, says UNMadagascar’s president, Andry Rajoelina, has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts in which the UN says at least 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured.Inspired by the “gen Z” protests in Kenya and Nepal, the three days of demonstrations are the largest the Indian Ocean island has seen in years, and the most serious challenge Rajoelina has faced since his re-election in 2023. Continue reading...

items.title: Madagascar president sacks government after days of deadly unrest
items.standfirst: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina said on Monday he was dissolving the government following days of youth-led protests over repeated water and power cuts in the Indian Ocean nation. The UN says at least 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured in the unrest, condemning the government's "violent response".
items.content: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina said on Monday he was dissolving the government following days of youth-led protests over repeated water and power cuts in the Indian Ocean nation. The UN says at least 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured in the unrest, condemning the government's "violent response".

ai_summary: Madagascar's president dissolved the government.
Protests were sparked by deteriorating living conditions.
At least 22 people have died in the protests.
The protests were inspired by "gen Z" protests.
The UN expressed shock at the use of force.

clusters.title: China: World's highest bridge opens to traffic
clusters.neutral_headline: China opens world's highest bridge

items.title: China: World's highest bridge opens to traffic
items.standfirst: 🇨🇳 World's highest bridge opens to traffic 🌉 The world's highest bridge opened to traffic in China, capping an engineering feat three years in the making and snatching the record from another bridge in the same province. ⛰️ The Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge towers 625 metres (2,051 feet) above a river and vast gorge in the country's rugged southern province of Guizhou, also home to the 565-metre Beipanjiang Bridge that is now the world's second highest.
items.content: 🇨🇳 World's highest bridge opens to traffic 🌉 The world's highest bridge opened to traffic in China, capping an engineering feat three years in the making and snatching the record from another bridge in the same province. ⛰️ The Huajiang Grand Canyon Bridge towers 625 metres (2,051 feet) above a river and vast gorge in the country's rugged southern province of Guizhou, also home to the 565-metre Beipanjiang Bridge that is now the world's second highest.

items.title: Title: India: Dozens dead, over 50 injured at actor-politician Vijay's rally
items.standfirst: 🇮🇳 At least 39 people were killed in a stampede during a rally for Tamil actor-turned-politician Vijay in Karur, southern India. The state has ordered an inquiry and police have filed a criminal case against leaders of Vijay’s party.
items.content: 🇮🇳 At least 39 people were killed in a stampede during a rally for Tamil actor-turned-politician Vijay in Karur, southern India. The state has ordered an inquiry and police have filed a criminal case against leaders of Vijay’s party.

items.title: The Indian superstar whose political rally turned fatal for dozens
items.standfirst: At least 40 people died over the weekend in a crowd crush at a political rally organised by Vijay's party.
items.content: At least 40 people died over the weekend in a crowd crush at a political rally organised by Vijay's party.

items.title: At least 40 dead and 124 injured in crush at Vijay rally in India
items.standfirst: Victims include nine children at election campaign gathering in Tamil Nadu led by popular actor and politicianPolice in India have opened a criminal case against the leaders of a party headed by the actor turned politician Vijay, after a crowd crush at one of his rallies killed 40 people and injured at least 124 others.Local officials reported that at least nine children had died at the rally, which took place on Saturday night in the Karur district of Tamil Nadu state in southern India. Vijay, one of the most popular and successful actors in Tamil cinema, who entered politics last year, was addressing the crowd for his Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) party before state elections early next year. Continue reading...
items.content: Victims include nine children at election campaign gathering in Tamil Nadu led by popular actor and politicianPolice in India have opened a criminal case against the leaders of a party headed by the actor turned politician Vijay, after a crowd crush at one of his rallies killed 40 people and injured at least 124 others.Local officials reported that at least nine children had died at the rally, which took place on Saturday night in the Karur district of Tamil Nadu state in southern India. Vijay, one of the most popular and successful actors in Tamil cinema, who entered politics last year, was addressing the crowd for his Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) party before state elections early next year. Continue reading...

ai_summary: At least 40 people died at a Vijay rally.
The rally was in Tamil Nadu, India.
Over 50 people were injured in the crush.
Police have filed a criminal case against party leaders.
Nine children were among the deceased.

clusters.title: Serbia arrests 11 accused of stirring Jewish-Muslim hate in France, Germany
clusters.neutral_headline: Serbia arrests 11 accused of stirring Jewish-Muslim hate in France, Germany

items.title: Serbia arrests 11 accused of stirring Jewish-Muslim hate in France, Germany
items.standfirst: Serbian police have arrested 11 people over hate-motivated acts in France and Germany, including defacing Jewish sites and placing pigs' heads near mosques, authorities said Monday. A twelfth suspect, "currently on the run", is accused of training the group nationals on "the instructions of a foreign intelligence service", the Interior Ministry said in a statement, without specifying their nationality. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.
items.content: Serbian police have arrested 11 people over hate-motivated acts in France and Germany, including defacing Jewish sites and placing pigs' heads near mosques, authorities said Monday. A twelfth suspect, "currently on the run", is accused of training the group nationals on "the instructions of a foreign intelligence service", the Interior Ministry said in a statement, without specifying their nationality. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.

items.title: Eleven arrested for placing pigs’ heads near French mosques and other hate crimes
items.standfirst: Serbian nationals also accused by Serbian police of defacing Jewish sites, as French officials investigate foreign interferenceSerbian police have arrested 11 people, accusing them of “inciting hatred” in France and Germany, and linking them to acts that include placing pigs’ heads near mosques and defacing Jewish sites.The arrests came days after French prosecutors said foreign interference was probably to blame for a spate of provocative acts that had targeted Jewish and Muslim sites in France in recent years, as tensions run high over the war in Gaza. French officials have previously said they were investigating Russia’s role in destabilising operations that have stoked social tensions and sown division in France. Continue reading...
items.content: Serbian nationals also accused by Serbian police of defacing Jewish sites, as French officials investigate foreign interferenceSerbian police have arrested 11 people, accusing them of “inciting hatred” in France and Germany, and linking them to acts that include placing pigs’ heads near mosques and defacing Jewish sites.The arrests came days after French prosecutors said foreign interference was probably to blame for a spate of provocative acts that had targeted Jewish and Muslim sites in France in recent years, as tensions run high over the war in Gaza. French officials have previously said they were investigating Russia’s role in destabilising operations that have stoked social tensions and sown division in France. Continue reading...

items.title: Serbia police arrest 11 people for placing pig heads outside French mosques
items.standfirst: Police in Serbia on Monday arrested 11 people suspected of leaving pig heads outside several mosques in and around Paris earlier this month and defacing a Holocaust memorial. The interior ministry accused the suspects of "inciting hatred", citing the involvement of a "foreign intelligence service".
items.content: Police in Serbia on Monday arrested 11 people suspected of leaving pig heads outside several mosques in and around Paris earlier this month and defacing a Holocaust memorial. The interior ministry accused the suspects of "inciting hatred", citing the involvement of a "foreign intelligence service".

ai_summary: Serbian police arrested 11 people.
The arrests are related to hate crimes in France and Germany.
The crimes include defacing Jewish sites.
Pig heads were placed near mosques.
A twelfth suspect is accused of training the group.

items.standfirst: Inquiry hears of children exposed to pornography and suffering ‘grievous’ harm without protection of schoolsThe Covid pandemic disrupted the “very fabric of childhood”, the UK inquiry has heard, on the first day of a four-week session devoted to its impact on children and young people.Clair Dobbin KC, counsel to the inquiry, said in her opening submission on Monday that some of the evidence drawn from the 18,000 stories and 400 targeted interviews would be “hard to listen to”. clusters.title: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response
clusters.neutral_headline: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response

items.title: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response
items.standfirst: A third of Etosha national park has been burned despite efforts of volunteers, who say troops were sent in too lateWildfires that raged through one of Africa’s largest national parks have been brought under control, Namibia’s government has said, amid criticisms over the response mechanism and limited resources.The fire broke out in Etosha national park, in the arid desert nation’s north, on 22 September. The government said it suspected charcoal production next to the park, which is home to 114 mammal species including the critically endangered black rhino, was to blame. Continue reading...
items.content: A third of Etosha national park has been burned despite efforts of volunteers, who say troops were sent in too lateWildfires that raged through one of Africa’s largest national parks have been brought under control, Namibia’s government has said, amid criticisms over the response mechanism and limited resources.The fire broke out in Etosha national park, in the arid desert nation’s north, on 22 September. The government said it suspected charcoal production next to the park, which is home to 114 mammal species including the critically endangered black rhino, was to blame. Continue reading...

items.title: Army sent to battle fire in Namibia tourist hotspot
items.standfirst: Etosha National Park is home to endangered black rhinos and more than 100 diverse mammal species.
items.content: Etosha National Park is home to endangered black rhinos and more than 100 diverse mammal species.

items.title: Namibia deploys army to fight wildfire burning third of Etosha game reserve
items.standfirst: Vast tract of park that is home to 114 mammal species, including critically endangered black rhino, affectedNamibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of the vast Etosha national park, one of Africa’s largest game reserves, officials said.The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros, and is a major tourist attraction. Continue reading...
items.content: Vast tract of park that is home to 114 mammal species, including critically endangered black rhino, affectedNamibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of the vast Etosha national park, one of Africa’s largest game reserves, officials said.The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros, and is a major tourist attraction. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Wildfires in Namibia's Etosha park have been contained.
Criticism arose over the response mechanism and resources.
A third of Etosha national park was burned.
The government suspects charcoal production caused the fire.
The army was deployed to fight the fire.
